DataElement.preferredName: Caries Occlusal Surface Dental Pulp Proximal Axial Maximum Depth Measurement
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the determination of the size or magnitude of the largest possible quantity as related to depth of margin of the biting surfaces of the premolar and molar teeth to the pulp (a richly vascularized and innervated connective tissue of mesodermal origin contained in the central cavity of a tooth and delimited by the dentin) wall or floor OR the proximal (area in mesial or distal surface of a tooth) to the axial wall (near pulpal wall parallel with long axis of the tooth) that has the decay of a tooth, in which it becomes softened, discolored, and/or porous.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Caries Occlusal Surface Dental Pulp Proximal Axial Depth
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to depth of margin of the biting surfaces of the premolar and molar teeth to the pulp (a richly vascularized and innervated connective tissue of mesodermal origin contained in the central cavity of a tooth and delimited by the dentin) wall or floor OR the proximal (area in mesial or distal surface of a tooth) to the axial wall (near pulpal wall parallel with long axis of the tooth) that has the decay of a tooth, in which it becomes softened, discolored, and/or porous.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The decay of a tooth, in which it becomes softened, discolored, and/or porous.

Concepts.definition: The decay of a tooth, in which it becomes softened, discolored, and/or porous.

Property.preferredName: Occlusal Surface Dental Pulp Proximal Axial Depth
Property.preferredDefinition: The biting surfaces of the premolar and molar teeth.:A richly vascularized and innervated connective tissue of mesodermal origin contained in the central cavity of a tooth and delimited by the dentin. It has formative, nutritive, sensory, and protective functions.:Proximal; situated nearest to a point of attachment or origin.:Situated on or along or in the direction of an axis.:Depth; extent downward or inward.

Concepts.definition: The biting surfaces of the premolar and molar teeth.

A richly vascularized and innervated connective tissue of mesodermal origin contained in the central cavity of a tooth and delimited by the dentin. It has formative, nutritive, sensory, and protective functions.
Situated nearest to a point of attachment or origin.
Situated on or along or in the direction of an axis.
The extent downward or inward; the perpendicular measurement from the surface downward to determine deepness.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

DataElementConcept.origin: PEARL CRF:Practitioners Engaged in Applied Research and Learning Network Case Report Form

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the determination of the size or magnitude of the largest possible quantity to the extent downward or inward of decay of a tooth, in which it becomes softened, discolored, and/or porous.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: the largest possible quantity or degree.:Depth; extent downward or inward.:Measurement; the size or magnitude of something.

Concepts.definition: The largest possible quantity or degree.
The extent downward or inward; the perpendicular measurement from the surface downward to determine deepness.
Annotation used to indicate the size or magnitude of something that was determined by comparison to a standard.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Greatest occlusal margin to p
ReferenceDocuments.description: Greatest occlusal margin to pulpal floor OR proximal margin to axial wall depth

DataElement.origin: PEARL CRF:Practitioners Engaged in Applied Research and Learning Network Case Report Form
